definition: to grow/to nourish/to increase/to cause/juice/taste/(dialect) to spout/to spurt
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: For nourishing the there are a lot of benefits.
sentences.chinese: 對滋補身體是有很大的好處的哈。

sentences.english: To use this skill you need Concentration tonics which can be bought at item store.
sentences.chinese: 要使用此技能需要濃度滋補品，可買的物品存儲。

sentences.english: Externally used Dan Gui is very versatile; if you are wanting mostly the invigorating properties you should use the TAIL of the herb, or Dang Gui Wei.
sentences.chinese: 如果主要需要滋補的話，可以使用當歸的尾部。

sentences.english: This sort of dietetic food has the effect of nourishing the human Body.
sentences.chinese: 這種食療食品有滋補營養的效用。

sentences.english: Cordyceps sinensis is a famous and nourishing herb in traditional Chinese medicine.
sentences.chinese: 冬蟲夏草爲名貴滋補藥。

sentences.english: The trepang is one kind of precious nutritious high quality goods.
sentences.chinese: 海蔘是一種珍貴的滋補佳品。

sentences.english: Walnut: moisten the skin, black hair and beard, nourish the liver and kidney, strengthen the muscle and bone.
sentences.chinese: 能滋潤肌膚，烏須黑髮，滋補肝腎，強筋健骨。

sentences.english: The labels on food products give a lot of information about their nutritional content.
sentences.chinese: 這種食療食品有滋補營養的效用。

sentences.english: Silkies have unique medicinal tonic function and the role of diet.
sentences.chinese: 烏骨雞有獨特的藥用功能和滋補食療作用。

sentences.english: The present invention has the effects of nourishing liver and kidney, tranquilizing and inducing resuscitation.
sentences.chinese: 具有滋補肝腎，安神通竅的功效。

sentences.english: Cordyceps sinensis (Berk. ) Sacc. , a parasitic fungus, is highly valued in China as a tonic food and herbal medicine for centuries.
sentences.chinese: 冬蟲夏草是一種藥食兩用的珍貴滋補品和中藥材。

sentences.english: The nourishing Beverages for all ages produced By our factory are most welcome to customers.
sentences.chinese: 本廠生產的滋補飲料，老少皆宜，深受顧客歡迎。

sentences.english: His old father requires nine mile nuts.
sentences.chinese: 他年老的父親需要進些滋補的東西。

sentences.english: Quail eggs nourishing than the role of eggs, but can also use the eggs.
sentences.chinese: 鵪鶉蛋的滋補作用要強於雞蛋，但也可以使用雞蛋。

sentences.english: The tonic will keep for 24 hours in the fridge.
sentences.chinese: 這個滋補劑可以在冰箱中保持24小時。

sentences.english: She woke them up and then made a hot and nutritious breakfast for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 她把他們吵醒然後做了一頓熱和滋補早餐爲大家。

definition: to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
to nourish one's skin/to maintain a youthful appearance
to whet the appetite/appetizing/to amuse oneself at sb's expense/to tease
to moisten the lungs/to make expectoration easy (medicine)
tonic food (food considered to be particularly healthful)/to eat such foods
to alleviate fever (medicine)/to clear internal heat (Chinese medicine)
